TF026400-FRENCH AGRI. & FORESTRY
            CONSULTANT TF,TF020761-AUSTRALIAN CONSULTANTS TRUST
            FUND (USD),TF026485-AUDIT OF VIET NAM BANK FOR AGRICULTURE

abstracts.cdata!:
The Agricultural Rehabilitation
            Project's outcome is rated as satisfactory,
            institutional development impact as modest, sustainability
            as likely, borrower performance as satisfactory, and Bank
            performance as satisfactory. OED assessment focused
            particularly on one sub-component, the Integrated Pest
            Management sub-component. It is the first time that OED has
            looked at impact from this new and expanding area of Bank
            rural lending. Efficiency and fiscal sustainability are
            questionable in this component. The project offers five main
            lessons: 1) Developing a poverty-related logical framework
            helps to clarify the poverty rationale. 2) Mechanisms to
            ensure sustainability become more a function of reforms that
            deliver self-sustaining institutions and cost recovery at
            the local level than public expenditure commitment from the
            center. 3) This project raises efficiency and sustainability
            questions about the use of separate PCUs. 4) Key elements in
            scaling up extension include maximizing farmer-to-farmer
            diffusion, enhancing the capacity of farmers to develop
            their own solutions, cost recovery or privatization,
            minimizing the cost of trainers through the use of
            farmer-trainers, and low-cost mass media approach. 5)
            Projects complex design could benefit from the Computer
            Project Management systems to track and manage expenditure.
